item.title: Supermarket leaving recycling cages and stock trolleys blocking the pavement outside, 31st August
item.description:
The supermarket is leaving cages, trolleys and recycling units outside on the pavement 24/7. This blocks access for wheelchair users, people with pushchairs, and children, and forces pedestrians into the road. It also creates rubbish and makes the street u

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Persistent litter trap, 31st August
item.description:
Ive raised this several times and even cleaned it up myself. There are two issues - why are there flimsy metal fences on the pavement? If the brick walls behind are at risk of falling, these femces aren't going to cut it. Second is the fact they been left there for months trapping tree debris and litter, for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 121, Plumstead Common Road, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: At the roundabout there is wild shrubs growing, 31st August
item.description:
The end of dual carriageway were the roundabout there is a over grown shrub the needs to be removed as it’s causing a blind view point when approaching the roundabout., also on Thames Road there is a lot of growth on the kerb side of the road that needs to attended and removed. The road towards leading to the railway arch/ recycling centre the road requires to be clean as sure the road sweeper would be able attend and sweep the area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
